info.title: Keyword Analysis API
info.description:
### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

post.description:
The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getKeywordsInfo` method provides you with the keyword overview showing its volume, CPC, level of competition, etc.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: the number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request. You can get no more than 1000 results per a query.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

keywords.description: Array with keywords to search for

withIntents.description:
Keyword intent
This parameter works for g_ua and g_us database only

sort.description:
Order of sorting the results in the format: `field: order`

- **field** — field to sort by (any numeric fields, except `suggestions_count` and `keywords_count` in *data* section of response)
- **order** — sort direction (`asc` — ascending, `desc` — descending)

Example `{"region_queries_count": "desc"}`

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the AND logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria.

region_queries_count_wide.description: Exact count of wide region queries.

region_queries_count_wide_to.description: Maximum count of wide region queries.

region_queries_count_wide_from.description: Minimum count of wide region queries.

intents_contain.description: List of intents that should be included.

intents_not_contain.description: List of intents that should be excluded.

right_spelling.description: Indicates whether the spelling is correct.

minus_keywords.description: List of keywords to exclude from the search.

found_results.description: Number of results found for the keyword

region_queries_count.description: Search volume in the selected region

types.description: List of special elements shown in SERP (for example, video, carousel or map)

geo_names.description: List of toponyms in the array (if toponyms are present in the keywords)

social_domains.description: Social domains listed top-10 by the keyword

right_spelling.description: Recommended correction of a misspelled keyword

difficulty.description: Competition level for a keyword to advance in organic search in the top-10 positions

intents.description:
Intents of the analyzed keyword
This parameter is returned for g_ua and g_us database only

post.description:
The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getKeywords` shows organic keywords associated with the researched keyword that domains are ranking for in Google's top-100 results and for every found keyword you'll see its volume, CPC and level of competition. 

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: **1 credit per row in response.** The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**:  With the Serpstat API, you can only get the first 60,000 results, regardless of the number and size of the queries themselves. For more data - use the export option in the Domain Analysis, Keyword Analysis, or URL Analysis sections, or contact the manager for a сustom data export.

minusKeywords.description: List of keywords to exclude from the search

withIntents.description:
Keyword intent
Intent parameter works for `g_au` and `g_us` database only

sort.description:
Order of sorting the results in the format: `field: order`

- **field** — field to sort by (any numeric fields in *data* section of response)
- **order** — sort direction (`asc` — ascending, `desc` — descending)

Example `{"region_queries_count": "desc"}`

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the AND logic. Numeric range fields (_from and _to) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (_contain and _not_contain) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

region_queries_count.description: Keyword volume by the selected region

keyword_length.description: Number of words in the keyword

right_spelling.description: True if contains all; false if does not contain all

keyword_not_contain_one_of.description: Does not contain one of (exact matching)

keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match.description: Does not contain one of (broad match)

lang.description: Specify keyword language. Language filtration works only for `g_ua` database

intents_contain.description: Contains one or several of intents

intents_not_contain.description: Does not contain one of the intents

size.description: Number of results per page in response

found_results.description: Number of results found for the keyword

region_queries_count.description: Search volume in the selected region

types.description: List of special elements shown in SERP (for example, video, carousel or map)

geo_names.description: List of toponyms in the array (if toponyms are present in the keywords)

social_domains.description: Social domains listed top-10 by the keyword

right_spelling.description: Recommended correction of a misspelled keyword

keyword_length.description: Number of words divided by space in a keyword

difficulty.description: Competition level for a keyword to advance in organic search in the top-10 positions

intents.description: Intents of the analyzed keyword This parameter is returned for g_ua and g_us database only

post.description:
The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getSuggestions` method shows search suggestions for the keyword you requested (they are found by the full-text search). 

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: **1 credit per row in response.** The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

> **Note**:  With the Serpstat API, you can only get the first 60,000 results, regardless of the number and size of the queries themselves. For more data - use the export option in the Domain Analysis, Keyword Analysis, or URL Analysis sections, or contact the manager for a сustom data export.

minus_keywords.description: List of keywords to exclude from the search

size.description: Number of results per page in response

geo_names.description: List of toponyms in the array (if toponyms are present in the keywords)

data.keyword: how.to.charge iphone.15. to preserve battery life
social security administration houston tx locations
social security administration office houston tx

post.description:
The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getRelatedKeywords` method shows all search queries that are semantically related to the searched keyword. 

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: **1 credit per row in response.** The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

> **Note**:  With the Serpstat API, you can only get the first 60,000 results, regardless of the number and size of the queries themselves. For more data - use the export option in the Domain Analysis, Keyword Analysis, or URL Analysis sections, or contact the manager for a сustom data export.

withIntents.description:
Keyword intent
This parameter works for `g_ua` and `g_us` database only

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

cost.description: Cost per click (in US $; exact match)

cost_from.description: Cost per click (in US $; exact match) from

cost_to.description: Cost per click (in US $; exact match) to

concurrency.description: Competition (how hard it is to promote a keyword to the top from 1-100)

concurrency_from.description: Competition from (how hard it is to promote a keyword to the top from 1-100)

concurrency_to.description: Competition to (how hard it is to promote a keyword to the top from 1-100)

keyword_length.description: Number of words in the keyword

keyword_length_from.description: Number of words in the keyword from

keyword_length_to.description: Number of words in the keyword to

difficulty_from.description: The difficulty of the keyword from

difficulty_to.description: The difficulty of the keyword to

region_queries_count.description: Volume of the keyword by the selected region

region_queries_count_from.description: Volume of the keyword by the selected region from

region_queries_count_to.description: Volume of the keyword by the selected region to

right_spelling.description: Display or not to display misspelled keywords (true or false)

keyword_not_contain.description: Does not contain all keywords (exact matching)

keyword_contain_one_of.description: Contains one of the keywords (exact matching)

keyword_not_contain_one_of.description: Does not contain one of the keywords (exact matching)

keyword_not_contain_one_of_copy.description: Does not contain one of the keywords (exact matching)

keyword_not_contain_broad_match.description: Does not contain all keywords (broad match)

keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match.description: Contains one of the keywords (broad match)

keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match.description: Does not contain one of the keywords (broad match)

geo_names.description: Array of toponyms, if the toponym is present in the keyword

types.description: The type of special elements in the output

intents_contain.description: Contains one or several of intents

intents_not_contain.description: Does not contain one of the intents

sort.description:
field — field to sort by

order — sort direction (asc — ascending, desc — descending)

Example `{"region_queries_count": "desc"}`

size.description: Number of results per page in response

cost.description: Cost per click (USD), that is monthly updated

geo_names.description: List of toponyms in the array (if toponyms are present in the keywords)

types.description: List of special elements shown in SERP (for example, video, carousel or map)

right_spelling.description: Recommended correction of a misspelled keyword

weight.description: The number of URLs in the top 20 results, which are ranked by the search keyword and the keyword from the report

difficulty.description: The assessment of the level of competition for a keyword to advance in organic search in the top-10 (from 1 to 100)

total.description: Total number of related keywords found

post.description:
The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getKeywordFullTop` method shows you Google's top-100 search results for the analyzed keyword.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: **1 credit per row in response.** The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.


Part of the API response, for which 1 credit is charged:
```json
{
        "position": 1,
        "url": "https://www.pizzahut.com/",
        "url_keywords_count": 49167,
        "domain": "pizzahut.com",
        "domain_visibility": 83.63,
        "domain_keywords_organic": 1620324,
        "domain_keywords_ppc": 435,
        "domain_top_10_keywords_count": 320885,
        "domain_sdr": 61,
        "domain_in_urls_count": 768658,
        "domain_in_domains_count": 13054,
        "domain_out_urls_count": 902329,
        "domain_out_domains_count": 174
}
```

sort.description:
Order of sorting the results in the format: `field: order`

- **field** — field to sort by (any field in *top* section of response)
- **order** — sort direction (`asc` — ascending, `desc` — descending)

Example `{"region_queries_count": "desc"}`

size.description: Number of results per page in response

url.description: URL of the domain in top results

url_keywords_count.description: The number of organic keywords the URL ranks for in Google top-100 results

domain_visibility.description: Visibility of a domain in top-20 search results. It's a relative indicator, which is calculated as a ratio of the amount and popularity of keywords a domain is shown for

domain_keywords_organic.description: The number of organic keywords the domain ranks for in Google top-100 results

domain_keywords_ppc.description: The number of ppc keywords the domain ranks for in Google top-100 results

domain_top_10_keywords_count.description: The number of organic keywords the domain ranks for in Google top-10 results

domain_sdr.description: Serpstat Domain Rank (SDR) — an indicator of domain authority

domain_out_urls_count.description: Number of links from the analyzed domain

domain_out_domains_count.description: Number of domains to which the analyzed domain links

cost.description: Cost per click (USD), that is monthly updated

difficulty.description: The assessment of the level of competition for a keyword to advance in organic search in the top-10 (from 1 to 100)

types.description: List of special elements shown in SERP (for example, video, carousel or map)

count_top_results.description: Number of results of the request

post.description:
The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getCompetitors` method lists the domains that rank for the given keyword in Google top-20 results.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**:  **1 credit per row in response.** The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request. 

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

> You can get no more than 1000 results per one request.

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

domain.description: List of domains to filter, e.g., www.apple.com

minus_domain.description: List of domains to exclude from the results, e.g., www.blackberry.com

sort.description:
Order of sorting the results in the format: `field: order`

- **field** — field to sort by (any field in *domain detailed information* section of response)
- **order** — sort direction (`asc` — ascending, `desc` — descending)

Example `{"region_queries_count": "desc"}`

size.description: Number of results per page in response

out_keywords.description: Number of keywords that are no longer ranked

rised_keywords.description: Number of keywords that improved in ranking

down_keywords.description: Number of keywords that dropped in ranking

post.description:
The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getAdKeywords` returns paid keywords and ads copies that pop up for the queried keyword in paid search results.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**:  **1 credit per row in response.** 
> The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request. 

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.


> You can get no more than 1000 results per one request.

minusKeywords.description: List of keywords to exclude from the search

filter.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

right_spelling.description: Filters by spelling. If true, spelling check is enabled; if false, spelling check is disabled.

minus_domain.description: Filters URL addresses by excluding the specified domain, e.g., www.domain.com.

url.description: Filters by exact URL, e.g., https://www.apple.com/airpods/.

types.description: TList of special elements shown in SERP (for example, `video`, `carousel` or `map`)

keyword_length.description: The total length of the keyword.

keyword_length_from.description: The minimum length of the keyword.

keyword_length_to.description: The maximum length of the keyword.

region_queries_count.description: The number of queries for the region, e.g., 1000.

region_queries_count_from.description: The minimum number of queries for the region.

region_queries_count_to.description: The maximum number of queries for the region.

region_queries_count_wide.description: The number of queries for a wide region, e.g., 1000.

region_queries_count_wide_from.description: The minimum number of queries for a wide region.

region_queries_count_wide_to.description: The maximum number of queries for a wide region.

position.description: The position of the item, e.g., 1.

position_from.description: The minimum position of the item.

position_to.description: The maximum position of the item.

concurrency.description: The number of concurrent requests, e.g., 7.

concurrency_from.description: The minimum number of concurrent requests.

concurrency_to.description: The maximum number of concurrent requests.

sort.description:
Order of sorting the results in the format: `field: order`

- **field** — field to sort by (any field in *data* section of response)
- **order** — sort direction (`asc` — ascending, `desc` — descending)

Example `{"region_queries_count": "desc"}`

size.description: Number of results per page in response

keyword.description: Keyword which domain's ad is displayed in SERP

keyword_length.description: Number of words divided by space in a keyword

type.description: List of special elements shown in SERP (for example, video, carousel or map)

found_results.description: Number of results found for the keyword

types.description: List of special elements shown in SERP (for example, video, carousel or map)

geo_names.description: List of toponyms in the array (if toponyms are present in the keywords)

difficulty.description: The assessment of the level of competition for a keyword to advance in organic search in the top-10 (from 0 to 100%)

total.description: Number of paid search results for the keyword

post.description:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getAdsCompetitors` method brings in the list of domain competitors in PPC.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**:  **1 credit per row in response.** 
> The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request. 

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

> You can get no more than 1000 results per one request.

sort.description:
Order of sorting the results in the format: `field: order`

- **field** — field to sort by (any field in *domain detailed information* section of response)
- **order** — sort direction (`asc` — ascending, `desc` — descending)

Example `{"region_queries_count": "desc"}`

size.description: Number of results per page in response

ads.description: Number of ads for a domain

all.description: Number of keywords for a domain in PPC

post.description:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getTopUrls` method returns website pages that rank for the largest amount of the analyzed keyword variations and have the highest traffic.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**:  **1 credit per request.** 

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

sort.description: Sorting by parameters(Any field in *urls* section of response)

keywords.description: General number of keywords in Google top-100 of the mentioned URL

traff.description: Estimated search traffic based on keyword positions and search volume

post.description:
Method `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.exportSuggestions` exports to `.csv` file search suggestions and questions.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**:  **1 credit per row in response.** 
> The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request. 

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.


> You can get no more than 1000 results per one request.

> **Note: output format is CSV**

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

difficulty.description: The difficulty of the keyword, e.g., 2.

difficulty_from.description: The minimum difficulty of the keyword.

difficulty_to.description: The maximum difficulty of the keyword.

cpc.description: Cost per click (CPC) in US dollars (exact match), e.g., 0.17.

region_queries_count.description: The volume of the keyword by the selected region, e.g., 1000.

region_queries_count_from.description: The minimum volume of the keyword by the selected region.

region_queries_count_to.description: The maximum volume of the keyword by the selected region.

keyword_length.description: The number of words in the keyword, e.g., 3.

keyword_length_from.description: The minimum number of words in the keyword.

keyword_length_to.description: The maximum number of words in the keyword.

questions.description: List of questions, see [question words](../serpstat-public-api/u6fdz4prsbezn-question-words). They are unique for certain search engine.

size.description: Number of results per page in response

post.description:
The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.getKeywordTop` method shows you Google's top-100 search results for the analyzed keyword.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: **1 credit per row in response.** The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request. You can get no more than 60000 results per one request.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

<!-- theme: danger -->
> **This method is deprecated**

Part of the API response, for which 1 credit is charged:
```json
{
          "position": 1,
          "url": "https://www.bestbuy.com/site/laptop-computers/all-laptops/pcmcat138500050001.c?id=pcmcat138500050001",
          "domain": "bestbuy.com",
          "subdomain": "www.bestbuy.com",
          "types": [
            "pic",
            "snip_breadcrumbs",
            "snip_image_thumbnail"
          ]
}
```

filters.description:
Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

Default: `{"top_size": 100}`

top_size.description: The number of results to retrieve from the top search results, e.g., 100.

position.description: The exact position of the keyword in search results, e.g., 1.

position_from.description: The minimum position of the keyword in search results.

position_to.description: The maximum position of the keyword in search results.

url.description: Filters by a specific URL, e.g., https://www.apple.com/iphone/.

exact_url.description: Filters by an exact URL, e.g., https://www.apple.com/iphone-13-pro/.

domain.description: Filters by domain name, e.g., www.apple.com.

minus_domain.description: Excludes results from the specified domain, e.g., www.blackberry.com.

size.description: Number of results per page in response

url.description: Page that ranks for the keyword

domain.description: Domain which ranks for the keyword

subdomain.description: Subdomain which ranks for the keyword

types.description: List of special elements shown in position

ads.description: Number of found Ads (if there are ads in the results)

types.description: List of special elements shown in SERP (for example, `video`, `carousel` or `map`)

post.description:
The `SerpstatKeywordProcedure.exportKeywordsPhrase` method exports to `.csv` file all organic keywords associated with the researched keyword.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**:  **1 credit per row in response.** 
> The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request. 

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

> **Note: output format is CSV**

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

difficulty.description: The difficulty level of the keyword, e.g., 3.

difficulty_from.description: The minimum difficulty level of the keyword.

difficulty_to.description: The maximum difficulty level of the keyword.

cpc.description: Cost per click (CPC) in US dollars (exact match), e.g., 30.

region_queries_count.description: The volume of the keyword by the selected region, e.g., 1000.

region_queries_count_from.description: The minimum volume of the keyword by the selected region.

region_queries_count_to.description: The maximum volume of the keyword by the selected region.

keyword_length.description: The number of words in the keyword, e.g., 3.

keyword_length_from.description: The minimum number of words in the keyword.

keyword_length_to.description: The maximum number of words in the keyword.

sort.description:
Order of sorting the results in the format: `field: order`

- **field** — field to sort by (any field in response)
- **order** — sort direction (`asc` — ascending, `desc` — descending)

Example `{"region_queries_count": "desc"}`

id.title: id
id.description: Request / response identifier, prodvided from your side, will be mirrored from request to `id` in response. Example "id":"123"

se.title: search engines short names
se.description:
Example `"se":"g_us"`. 
Reffer to full list of [search engines](../serpstat-public-api/ba97ni814ao9p-search-engine-short-names)
